metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28998 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Nextcloud Desktop Client is a tool to synchronize files from NextcloudServer. Starting with version 3.0.0 and prior to version 3.6.5, a maliciousserver administrator can gain full access to an end-to-end encryptedfolder. They can decrypt files, recover the folder structure, and add newfiles.â€‹ Users should upgrade the Nextcloud Desktop client to 3.6.5 toreceive a patch. No known workarounds are available.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28998` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

caja-nextcloud - 3.7.3-1
dolphin-nextcloud - 3.7.3-1
libnextcloudsync0 - 3.7.3-1
nautilus-nextcloud - 3.7.3-1
nemo-nextcloud - 3.7.3-1
nextcloud-desktop - 3.7.3-1
nextcloud-desktop-cmd - 3.7.3-1
nextcloud-desktop-common - 3.7.3-1
nextcloud-desktop-l10n - 3.7.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nextcloud-desktop package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.3-1').
